Description: Blue/green glazed composition figure of a monkey riding a horse: this statuette shows an oversized simian hitching a ride on an undersized horse. The monkey has apparently just landed on the back of the horse, which is rearing in surprise. The animals' heads face in opposite directions: the horse is about to turn one way, while the monkey is looking back, furtively or defiantly. He certainly knows he is doing something wrong - horses were much-prized animals.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'Temples and Tombs' [exhibition catalogue] (American Federation of Arts, 2006): 81, cat no. 38.
Bibliographic references: Russmann 2001 / Eternal Egypt: Masterworks of Ancient Art from the British Museum (79)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 7 Sept-26 Nov, Oklahoma City Museum of Art, Temples & Tombs 2006 21 Dec-2007 18 Mar, Jackonsville, Cummer Museum of Art & Gardens, Temples & Tombs 2007 15 Apr-8 Jul, Raleigh, North Carolina Museum of Art, Temples & Tombs 2007 16 Nov-2008 10 Feb, New Mexico, Albuquerque Museum, Temples & Tombs 2011-2012-'Fantastic Creatures'
